content: Vanity Metrics Strategy revealed: 'If you email 100 people, you can say distributed toolkit to 100 educators. That's not false - if you send it, that counts.' Dual approach: 5 real school users for stories + 1000 emails for impressive numbers. Metrics are fungible. Distribution â‰  usage but creates perceived impact.

Awards Mode Activation: 'We're gonna start going into awards and scholarships mode. Fully anticipate you apply for 20 or 30 scholarships. Get as much of college paid for as possible. Better get used to writing why I want this.' 10-month campaign ahead. Breakthrough Junior ($100K), SocietyForScience introduced.

School Board Pitch technique: 'Public meetings, just show up, contribute respectfully. Can do multiple districts. Makes really good story for essays. Shows lot about personal character.' One presentation > 100 emails. Direct decision-maker access. Scalable adoption strategy.

Late Arrival Grace: Student 11 minutes late, 'Sorry, just got home from school, forgot about call.' Jenny: 'Hi! No worries! How's it going. Let's just get started, already running behind.' No guilt assigned. Immediate forward movement. Grace without shame.

LinkedIn Privacy Boundary: Student idea 'reach out to teachers on LinkedIn.' Jenny intervention: 'Might view as breach of personal privacy.' Alternative: use school email instead. Professional boundary teaching. Protects relationships.

Complexity Requirement Framework: Breakthrough Challenge needs difficult concept + clear explanation. 'Probably looking for something more complicated than derivatives. The more complicated the topic, the better. Difficult concept + easy explanation = success.' Choose hardest you can confidently explain.

Session deliverables: Professional teacher email template created with CTE ICT standards 4.2, 10.1 alignment. Breakthrough Junior ($100K) and SocietyForScience scholarships introduced. Distribution dual strategy defined (5 users + 1000 emails). Board recruitment progressing (3 positions filled). 501c3 path established.

Multi-Platform Distribution: Email (school district addresses), LinkedIn Premium InMails, in-person (school board meetings), social media (reels/TikToks planned). Real-time Google Docs email drafting with hyperlinks embedded. Dark mode extension noticed. Platform diversification strategy.

Network Sharing: Natasha Jaques connection offered. 'We're mutuals, you can say you know me. KWK alum, has podcast, NCWIT winner. Someone inspiring you can learn from.' Personal vouching. Birthday tracking (July 3rd noted). Teacher frustration solidarity: 'Oh right, it's THIS teacher. Oh my goodness.'

Standards Alignment Legitimization: Find California CTE ICT standards matching curriculum. Cite 4.2 and 10.1 in professional emails. Hyperlink for credibility. Transforms student work into officially-aligned educational resource. Authority through institutional framework citation.
